name: Dan Panorama Haifa

reviews.text: Beautiful location, don't miss the Terrace Bar with a view of the whole city from the top of Mt. Carmel. Good hotel food. Super nice people and service. The rooms were great too. Good for a business trip as well as just plain enjoying the city.
reviews.title: one year later but still haven't forgotten the great service and facilities

reviews.text: Only issue might be elevators certain days.
reviews.title: ancient structure, horrible service.

reviews.text: -Sharon from Allegro Systems
reviews.title: Amazing staff

reviews.text: I stayed during my last trip to Haifa. As soon as I arrived I immediately understood I did the wrong choice, the personnel were rude to their guests, no courtesy at all, the place was old style and the restaurant seems to make yu living in the past (late 60's). Rooms were nothing special and maybe even under the average but sometimes it happens. Nevermind but I won't be here again.
reviews.title: Heavenly Habor View

reviews.text: Would like to say a big thank you to all the staff at the dan panorama hotel they have been very welcoming a special thank you to the bar staff Hannan, Sol, Talya, Svetlana, Lior hope u all have a happy 2013 :) xx
reviews.title: Most wonderful staff

reviews.text: Two adjoining 12th floor rooms worked will for our family of four. Odd mix of decor styles spanning decades. Bathroom was brand new, but night tables were from the early 70s. Friendly restaurant staff and great buffet breakfasts. Our confirmation sheet noted free in-room internet, but it was only avail in lobby & biz center. Otherwise, all good.
reviews.title: Good Place on Mt. Carmel

reviews.text: The Dan Panorama lives up to it's Name. The Hotel sits at the crest of Mount Carmel in Haifa Israel. The rooms are a little dated, but they are well maintained and clean. The staff is most accommodating and everyone strives to insure that you have a good stay. I have only eaten Breakfast, it is a buffet style, but I found it to be very good.
reviews.title: The Panarama has a View!
Excellent breakfast! We'd come back.
reviews.text: The Business Center on the 20th floor is staffed with very helpful & attractive women. You can even get a glass of Red or White wine as you catch up on your work, or personal Email.
I recommend the Dan Panorama to anyone who is traveling on Business or for a family vacation.
reviews.title: dan panorama hotel in haifa
Nice hotel
reviews.text: They had the best breakfast we had during our 12 day trip! And the service during breakfast was excellent! In general, the hotel is a mix of old a new. You can tell that some things (the lobby, bar area, and bathroom in our room) were recently renovated and of a very high quality. The room was very clean and comfortable, but had fixtures (lamp, bed and dresser) from the 70's. It was a nice hotel, not superb but we'd definitely stay there again.

Back at the Dan Panorama for another month (reviewed last year at this same time) and couldn't have been happier. The hotel is in a wonderful location, within walking distance of many excellent cafes and restaurants, across the street from the Haifa Zoo, backs onto the Louis Promenade, the Tikotin and Mane Katz Museums and the Bahai Gardens. The staff are exceptionally accommodating, the rooms are very comfortable (bathrooms have been renovated since last year) and I had a wonderful view from my window.
reviews.title: Love this hotel

reviews.text: The staff are all very polite and helpful. The food that is on offer is at a high standard. The accommodation is of a good standard. The views are outstanding and doesn't matter what window you look out of.
reviews.title: Top class hotel

reviews.text: I stayed here for six weeks at the end of 2012. The hotel is in an amazing location in the Carmel center. The staff are extremely nice and professional.
reviews.title: Very outdated

reviews.text: Unfortunately, the rooms are extremely outdated and in desperate need of renovations. They said they remodeled the hotel but not the rooms just the lobby and some bathrooms. An executive room just puts you in a room with a remodeled bathroom but the room itself is the same. Internet is extremely expensive and very slow on some of the floors, when i asked about getting it fixed they gave me the number and made me call. After a half dozen conversations with their provider it never got fixed.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Gym in Haifa (maybe even in Israel??)

reviews.text: If it weren't for the bar/restaurant staff being so nice and helpful this hotel would be below average.
reviews.title: Dan Panorama haven for the weary traveller

reviews.text: Well done, Dan Panorama. I had a corner Executive room on the 19th floor with a magnificent view of the Bay. You can expect about a 60 Sheq taxi ($16 give or take) ride from the Hof Karmel train station (with service to the airport for 39.5 Sheq, a little over $10 each way). It's an hour or so drive to the Golan Heights and the Sea of Galilee. From the Golan Heights, you can see the beautiful mountains of Jordan.
reviews.title: A view from the top

reviews.text: But, back to the hotel. The staff is courteous and professional, and the rooms, although a bit small, are well appointed and maintained. Wi-Fi in the room is pay per use, but free in the 20th floor business lounge. The only suggestion I'd make for improvement is to have at least one more electric outlet in the room, so you can charge your phone and laptop at the same time.
reviews.title: Staying in Haifa

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet is marvelous, with a wide variety of food that changes daily. There's a small shopping center that connects to the hotel - use the currency exchange there for the same rates as the airport - much better than the hotel desk.
reviews.title: Best Location, Great Stay

reviews.text: I'd certainly welcome the opportunity to stay at the Dan Panorama again.
reviews.title: Standard

reviews.text: The hotel was a nice place to stay, very close to the center of things, but the Business Center was a wonderful addition to the package. As a business traveller away from home the Business Center was a place you could have a light snack, a glass of wine, and still get a lot of work done. The support staff was more than helpful
reviews.title: Hotel is too old and need a total renovation.

description: Haifa's exciting Dan Panorama Hotel rises twenty-one stories high above Mount Camel, offering thrilling views of Haifa Bay and miles of Israel’s beautiful Mediterranean coastline. This modern hotel is centrally and uniquely located, being directly linked to the fashionable Panorama Mall, with its fine stores, elegant cafes and cinemas. Close by, the attractive Carmel Center bustles with life, offering an array of shops, cafes and entertainment venues.
